clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study of SI-B001 in Combination With Paclitaxel in the Treatment of Recurrent and Metastatic HNSCC
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SI-B001 in Combination With Paclitaxel in the Treatment of Recurrent and Metastatic Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck

brief_summary.textblock:
Main purpose:
1. To evaluate the efficacy of SI-B001 monotherapy RP2D in combination with paclitaxel in patients with locally advanced or metastatic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (non-nasopharyngeal carcinoma) obtained in phase I clinical trials.
2. To evaluate the safety and tolerability of SI-B001 monotherapy RP2D in combination with paclitaxel in patients with locally advanced or metastatic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (non-nasopharyngeal carcinoma) obtained in phase I clinical trials.
Secondary purpose:
1. To evaluate the PK/PD of the research drug SI-B001 in combination with paclitaxel.
2. To evaluate the immunogenicity of SI-B001.

clinical_study.condition: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

arm_group.description: Administration by intravenous infusion. SI-B001 was administered intravenously once a week (QW). The first intravenous infusion is 120 min±10min. If the infusion reaction is tolerable during the first administration, the subsequent administration can be completed in 60-120 min. Paclitaxel dose was 80mg/m2 QW. SI-B001 and paclitaxel were used on the same day. After the infusion of SI-B001, paclitaxel pretreatment and paclitaxel infusion were performed for no less than 3 hours. The 4-week cycle of the study was maintained until disease progression or cessation due to intolerable toxicity or other reasons

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
